metadata.title: CVE-2024-46680 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:Bluetooth: btnxpuart: Fix random crash seen while removing driverThis fixes the random kernel crash seen while removing the driver, whenrunning the load/unload test over multiple iterations.1) modprobe btnxpuart2) hciconfig hci0 reset3) hciconfig (check hci0 interface up with valid BD address)4) modprobe -r btnxpuartRepeat steps 1 to 4The ps_wakeup() call in btnxpuart_close() schedules the psdata->work(),which gets scheduled after module is removed, causing a kernel crash.This hidden issue got highlighted after enabling Power Save by defaultin 4183a7be7700 (Bluetooth: btnxpuart: Enable Power Save feature onstartup)The new ps_cleanup() deasserts UART break immediately while closingserdev device, cancels any scheduled
